titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Still in bed and very disgusted. My place in the Cathedral was taken by
Peter's who is accounted to be the most eloquent of the city incumbents. I am sorry that promising little arrangement has broken down so far as the Bishop goes.
I dictated to Ella letters to
made his expedition to Weobley after lunch, & brought back a glowing account of both church and parson.
